physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Large, orange tonsils; hepatosplenomegaly; thrombocytopenia; erythrocytes with altered morphology (stomatocytes) and function (decreased osmotic resistance); low serum levels of total cholesterol (58 mg/dL), triglycerides (184 mg/dL), and HDL cholesterol (4 mg/dL); very low serum apolipoprotein A-I (3.9 mg/dL) and A-II (1.7 mg/dL) concentrations.

Exertional chest pain; ECG stress test positive for myocardial ischemia; coronary angiogram revealed severe atherosclerosis: 95% stenosis in the mid portion of the right coronary artery, 75% stenosis at the crux, and 95% stenosis in the proximal portion of the left anterior descending coronary artery.

physical_examinations.date: Ten days after initial treatment (e.g., March 2006)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Emergency episode of ventricular fibrillation treated with DC shock during stenting of coronary arteries.
Restenosis in paclitaxel-eluting stent in the proximal left anterior descending coronary artery.
Referred for coronary angiography due to positive ECG stress test for myocardial ischemia; critical stenosis at the left main coronary artery identified.
